Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup with offset on inside and outside; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: black band at top of rim; on lip, black-figure hare (with added red on front of neck) running to right into a snare; crossing its back, a rather thin lagobolon; crossing the hare’s hind legs, a curving line.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.27)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0551) (Phase 1)
